summary: This is an internal FBI email dated August 23, 2019, providing an update on the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. It details recent and upcoming interviews with Bureau of Prisons (BOP) guards and inmates, the status of evidence collection (including phones and a medical examiner report), and ongoing analysis of communications and contraband related to the incident.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.role: Deceased inmate, subject of death investigation
persons.context: The document is an update on the investigation into his death while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He was transported to the hospital and pronounced deceased.

persons.name: DeLeon
persons.context: An inmate scheduled for a proffer/interview. He was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) during a time period when Epstein was also there, though not on the same tier.

persons.name: Arroyo
persons.context: An inmate scheduled for a proffer/interview. He was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) during a time period when Epstein was also there, though not on the same tier.

events.title: Contraband discovered on Epstein
events.description: A BOP Guard conducted a search of Epstein and discovered contraband.

events.title: Proffer of BOP Guard
events.description: A BOP Guard, who had been provided an attorney, gave a proffer. The results were consistent with her first interview.

events.title: Interviews with BOP Guards conclude
events.description: Interviews with BOP Guards, who were responsible for collecting inmate count slips and who travelled with Epstein to the hospital, were completed.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was transported from the Metropolitan Correctional Center to a hospital via ambulance and was pronounced deceased. The document is an update on the ongoing death investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC, implied location of Epstein's death)
26 Federal Plaza (FBI office in New York)
New Jersey (location of an attorney's office where a BOP Guard phone was to be retrieved)
Hospital (unnamed, where Epstein was pronounced deceased)
keyFacts: The document is a real-time update on the active FBI investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
Investigators were interviewing BOP guards who were with Epstein when he was transported to the hospital and pronounced dead.
Contraband was discovered on Epstein during a search by a BOP guard on August 14, 2019, shortly before his death.
The investigation involved analyzing multiple phones seized from individuals and using CAST (Cell Analysis Survey Team) analysis to examine communications.
Several key witnesses, including inmates DeLeon and Arroyo who were in the SHU around the time Epstein was there, were scheduled for proffers and interviews.
